column2: Blood donations down along Front Range because of snowstorm
column3:
The weekend snowstorm in northeastern Colorado and Wyoming forced the cancelation of several blood drives, according to Vitalant Blood Donation.
Patients in Colorado, and across the nation, in need of transfusions are relying on donors, Vitalant said on its website and on social media.

column2: I-70 over Vail Pass reopened after shutting down in both directions late-afternoon Tuesday
column3:
Interstate 70 shut down Tuesday afternoon in both directions over Vail Pass for a couple of hours as a safety concern after a highway crash, according to CDOT.
At about 4 p.m. westbound traffic on I-70 was shut down by a crash on the west side of the Vail Pass summit, CDOT said. The westbound traffi...

column2: Lebanon registers 52 more coronavirus deaths, 3,480 new cases
column3: Lebanon registered 52 new coronavirus deaths and 3,480 more cases in the last 24 hours, the Health Ministry said Tuesday, as vaccinations continued at a very slow pace.

column2: Erdogan says Saudi Arabia wants armed Turkish drones
column3: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Tuesday that Saudi Arabia has requested a supply of Turkish military drones.

column2: Fears of security risks grow amid worsening economic meltdown
column3: The Lebanese pound’s dramatic and unchecked nosedive against the US dollar is threatening to plunge the crises-stricken country into total chaos and security risks that would further add to the misery of the Lebanese who are facing poverty as a result of an unprecedented financial downturn.

column2: Real Madrid make light work of Atalanta to reach quarters
column3: Real Madrid easily overcame Atalanta 3-1 at home in their Champions League last-16 second leg Wednesday to stroll into the quarterfinals 4-1 on aggregate.

column2: Man City cruise into Champions League quarterfinals
column3: Manchester City cruised into the quarterfinals of the Champions League as early goals from Kevin De Bruyne and Ilkay Gundogan beat Borussia Moenchengladbach 2-0 in Budapest Tuesday and sealed a 4-0 aggregate victory.

column2: The List: Deal volume fell at many Atlanta CRE brokerages in 2020
column3: The companies on the list reported gross dollar volume of $78.7 billion for 2020, down 8.3% from the $85.8 billion in deals the top 20 firms reported for 2019.

column2: Silicon Valley's Y-Combinator backs Atlanta startup Procoto a year after its launch
column3: Y-Combinator accepted Procoto into its winter 2021 cohort and provided a $125,000 investment.

column2: Atlanta approves inclusionary zoning on for-sale housing in Westside Park neighborhoods
column3: Private investment is not the only factor contributing to rapid gentrification. Much like the Atlanta Beltline, it is the city's own investment in the 280-acre Westside Park that is a magnet to developers.

column2: City greenlights tax hike on businesses and apartments to fund completion of Atlanta Beltline
column3: The legislation, introduced in January, was put on a fast track for approval after Atlanta BeltLine Inc. said completing the trail by its 2030 deadline was in danger without an infusion of millions of dollars.

column2: Here are 8 new residential projects planned around metro Atlanta
column3: The new projects include two proposed by Texas home building giant D.R. Horton that would bring 300 new homes to DeKalb and Gwinnett counties.

column2: Honey Baked Ham picks retired Coca-Cola exec to succeed Linda van Rees
column3: A former top Coca-Cola exec is taking over the top spot for another household name.

column2: Canada's CI Financial expands in Southeast, buys Atlanta's Brightworth
column3: A growing Canadian wealth management firm is expanding in the Southeast and will buy one of Atlanta's largest financial planning firms.

column2: New York architecture firm expands into Atlanta
column3: A New York architecture and interior design firm is expanding into a mixed-use in Atlanta's Midtown neighborhood.

column2: Hank Aaron museum coming to Georgia State, as memorial to be bigger than expected
column3: Georgia State has been working with Hank Aaron's widow, Billye, on the design concept for the project, which will be a new tourist destination for the city.

column2: Prince Philip has left the hospital after a month
column3:
Prince Philip is out of the hospital.

column2: French health ministry warns of new coronavirus variant that may be able to evade PCR tests
